metadata.title: CVE-2022-22995 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: The combination of primitives offered by SMB and AFP in their defaultconfiguration allows the arbitrary writing of files. By exploiting thesecombination of primitives, an attacker can execute arbitrary code.

criterions.comment: netatalk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
